intro: Chondrilla tenuis, commonly known as the slender chondrilla, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Mediterranean and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flower heads. The plant has a low-growing, sprawling habit with hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Chondrilla tenuis is often found in disturbed or open habitats, such as roadsides and fields.
